channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: COVID-19 continues to spread while Victoria works to stop the growing case numbers in Melbourne.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: NSW on high alert as Victoria expects further COVID-19 case spike; Australian death toll stands at 106

item.dc:creator: Natassia Chrysanthos
item.description: The cancer patient had denied a passerby's request for a cigarette, when the man allegedly ripped out the patient’s IV tubes before kicking him in the stomach.
item.title: Cancer patient allegedly assaulted after denying man a cigarette

item.dc:creator: Kate McClymont
item.description: NSW government wins order to recover $360,000 from Eddie Obeid relating to legal expenses from his failed court action - but millions remain unpaid.
item.title: Win for taxpayers in hunt for Obeid's millions in legal fees

item.dc:creator: Kate Aubusson
item.description: It's not what anyone expects when they're expecting, but four tragic infant deaths in the past 18 months have caused a local health district to search for answers.
item.title: Bundle of grief: urgent review into baby deaths at Blacktown Hospital

item.description: The US President said that he "very recently" took a test measuring his mental acuity and "aced" it, but the White House would not say when he took it or why.
item.title: Trump says he 'aced' cognitive test, but White House won't release details

item.dc:creator: Stephanie Darling
item.description: Instead of opting for a fail-safe red, push out the boat and try a chocolatey hue.
item.title: The newest lip shade to try this winter

item.description: Amazon has requested employees remove the TikTok video sharing app from their mobile devices by July 10 over "security risks," according to a memo sent to employees.
item.title: Amazon bans TikTok from employees' phones, citing 'security'

item.description: The 58-year-old said her detention in New York put her at "serious risk" of contracting the COVID-19 disease.
item.title: Ghislaine Maxwell denies charges she aided Jeffrey Epstein, says she deserves bail

item.description: The tally represents the largest one-day increase by any country since the pandemic emerged in China last year.
item.title: US sets one-day record with more than 60,500 COVID-19 cases

item.description: Johnny Depp has told London's High Court that his ex-wife Amber Heard or her friend had defecated in their bed in what he described as a "fitting end to the relationship".
item.title: Ex-wife or friend defecated in their bed in 'fitting end' to marriage, Depp tells court

item.dc:creator: Julia Naughton
item.description: She built a devoted following and wildly successful career from her belief in the sanctity of marriage. Then, she fell in love with a woman.
item.title: Glennon Doyle wants you to stop being grateful, thank you very much

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.dc:creator: Konrad Marshall
item.description: The ongoing debate about what to do with our feral brumby population has been a wild ride. A bloody solution looms.
item.title: 'They'll have an uprising on their hands': the fight to save wild horses

item.dc:creator: Tim Elliott
item.description: Nearly 30 years ago, a how-to guide called DOS For Dummies was published. The reaction to the user-friendly and accessible book led to a global phenomenon.
item.title: Dumb luck? No way. The billion-dollar smarts of the 'For Dummies' empire

item.dc:creator: Tom Rabe
item.description: The government hopes the jarring economic impacts of the hard closure will be outweighed by sheltering NSW from the worst of Victoria's coronavirus storm.
item.title: 'It looked inevitable': How the NSW border to Victoria was closed

item.dc:creator: Peter Hartcher
item.description: We got the idea into our heads that once we'd got through a couple of months of lockdown, we'd revert blissfully back to life as we'd known it. The coronavirus has other plans.
item.title: 'The assassin is out there': Virus calls for a new way of thinking

item.dc:creator: Vince Rugari
item.description: One of the founding fathers of the GWS Giants believes there is nothing "ghastly" about ANZ Stadium or its bid to host the AFL grand final.
item.title: 'Futuristic thinking': Sheedy backs Sydney push for AFL grand final

item.dc:creator: David Crowe
item.description: Australians could wait for two and a half years for a widespread vaccine to counter the coronavirus, former New Zealand prime minister Helen Clark has warned.
item.title: Virus inquiry chief Helen Clark warns of long wait for vaccine

item.dc:creator: Georgina Robinson
item.description: Andrew Forrest speaks to the Herald about the lessons he learnt from Global Rapid Rugby and why he's cautiously optimistic about Australian rugby's future.
item.title: 'Twiggy' warms to Australian rugby as Force exile ends

item.dc:creator: Julie Power
item.description: Manly has reduced the speed limit across its town centre from the ferry to the beach to protect pedestrians and cyclists and Liverpool will do the same next week.
item.title: Manly cuts speeds to 30km/h to become NSW's slowest suburb

item.dc:creator: Tim Biggs
item.description: Even without considering the app's Chinese ownership, users should be aware of how much data the app is scooping up, experts say.
item.title: TikTok's data collection a worry, regardless of nationality

item.dc:creator: Kate Aubusson
item.description: A new coronavirus cluster has been traced back to a popular pub in south-west Sydney and a man has tested positive after towing a caravan across the state border from Melbourne to Sutherland.
item.title: Sydney pub cluster revealed as Victorian infections soar

item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Knight
item.description: Victoria's second wave of coronavirus has thrown a spanner in Qantas take off plans.
item.title: Qantas is creating an army of zombie pilots

item.dc:creator: Tom Switzer
item.description: Disagree all you like, but in a free, liberal society, everyone should be free to express an opinion.
item.title: In bed with Noam: The fight to say what you think makes strange bedfellows

item.dc:creator: Georgina Mitchell
item.description: The Industrial Relations Commission found the officer had a propensity for "excessive and unreasonable force" and a pattern of "overzealous use of authority".
item.title: Ex-police officer fails to get job back after choking man who filmed police

item.dc:creator: Robert Moran
item.description: Founder David Handley says the Bondi exhibition is still aiming for its October launch, despite Melbourne's coronavirus lockdown setting plans "back to square one".
item.title: 'Lots of dancing on the spot': Sculpture by the Sea forges ahead

item.dc:creator: Kate Jones
item.description: It's synonymous with '80s soft rock and pop, men in black sunglasses and elevator music, but now the saxophone is shrugging off its cringey past.
item.title: Return of the sax: yes, the once-'daggy' instrument is having a revival

item.dc:creator: Julia Baird
item.description: The endless talk about ending workplace harassment is just that: talk.
item.title: Dinosaurs thrive when nothing ever changes

item.dc:creator: Sami Shah
item.description: More people have a voice than ever before, so debate and the occasional eruption should be expected - and respected.
item.title: Arguing over the arts is sort of the point

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: While many funds are fighting to retain positive returns or bracing for negatives, the tech investors are seeing double digit growth as the world moves online.
item.title: Rampant technology sector offers growth in a low yield environment

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: The enforced lockdown due to the global pandemic has seen the rate of online shopping hit new heights with estimations it could reach upwards of 15 per cent of total retail sales.
item.title: E-commerce will keep demand high for industrial property

item.dc:creator: Caroline Zielinski
item.description: For Kathryn and Martin, postponing their wedding wasn't an option. Despite changing restrictions they're determined to get their "three hours of happiness".
item.title: 'A little joy in our lives': caught in the crosshairs, love still wins

item.description: Australia's gravely ill coronavirus patients have among the best survival rates in the world, but doctors say there's no guarantee it will last.
item.title: 'Feeling anxious': Second peak puts COVID-19 survival rates under threat

item.dc:creator: Zoe Samios
item.description: Merging Vodafone's struggling Australian operations with TPG Telecom was always the plan for Inaki Berroeta, who has knack for untangling difficult projects.
item.title: From fixing Vodafail to running TPG: Berroeta's race to the big league

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: The government's release of its 'future of coal' statement has made those communities located in designated exploration zones wondering what's going to happen to them.
item.title: From wombats to Wollombi, new mining plans stoke community concerns

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: Boutique property finance development outfit Pallas Group has pre-leased 60 per cent of the space of its new South Melbourne headquarters.
item.title: Pallas pads out inner-city headquarters

item.description: Nice to see Victorian police protecting themselves and the public by wearing masks.
item.title: Why are NSW police not wearing masks in public?

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: Residents of Wollombi in the Hunter Valley have vowed to resist plans for mining in their region.
item.title: 'Like throwing a grenade': historic town braces for coal mining threat

item.dc:creator: Carolyn Cummins
item.description: Centuria Capital is set to boost its international platform as it mops up its takeover of New Zealand's Augusta Capital after its offer went unconditional on Wednesday.
item.title: Centuria Capital on track for full takeover of Augusta

item.description: The Arts Epicentre at Caroline Chisholm College in Braybrook, is the 12th project that the school has commissioned from Branch Studio Architecture.
item.title: Braybrook convent makes way for school's performing arts centre

item.dc:creator: Andrew Hornery
item.description: Ex-wives, rising Aussie pop stars and a gossip columnist made for an unhappy crew on board James Packer's IJE which has been cruising off Mexico.
item.title: It's Billionaire Bachelor Afloat as rumours fly on Packer's superyacht

item.description: Passionately held opinions should not be a replacement for considered ideas and debate.
item.title: Society needs a 'new abnormal': time to shake up the social contract

item.description: Ex-wives, rising pop stars and a gossip columnist made for an unhappy crew on Packer's superyacht.
item.title: Tablet interactive: It's Billionaire Bachelor Afloat as rumours fly on Packer's superyacht

item.dc:creator: Karl Quinn
item.description: Lots of films made with a big-screen experience in mind may never play in cinemas. But it's not entirely a bad thing, say some filmmakers.
item.title: Pandemic forces big movies to the small screen, and it's not all bad

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: Fewer complaints were made to Brisbane City Council about noisy dogs, construction or refrigerators and airconditioners.
item.title: Quieter Brisbane leads to fewer noise complaints during pandemic

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: It has no airconditioning, no power steering, and rumbles from zero to 100km/h in a leisurely 12 minutes - but "Bus 80" is a heritage treasure.
item.title: One of Brisbane's oldest buses back on the streets with new silver lining

item.dc:creator: Jewel Topsfield
item.description: Glendale Aged Care's director of operations says the situation in Victoria is 'frightening' as the new cases come just days after a 90-year-old resident was diagnosed with the deadly virus.
item.title: Four staff test positive to COVID-19 in aged care home outbreak

item.dc:creator: Michael Bachelard
item.description: It would be “almost unbearable” to lock down for a second time, Daniel Andrews said in May. This week he ordered it to happen.
item.title: 'COVID normal': Daniel Andrews feels the heat over a crisis without end

item.dc:creator: Bianca Hall
item.description: Other states and territories are poised to offer more help after Victorian health authorities failed on multiple occasions to inform close contacts of confirmed COVID-19 cases in a timely fashion.
item.title: Victoria's contact tracing system to be bolstered after string of failures

item.dc:creator: John Silvester
item.description: One young Pan Pacific Hotel quarantine guest, resplendent in bike shorts, took advantage of a sunny winter’s day to escape and take selfies performing a series of impressive handstands at South Wharf.
item.title: Lock-down lunacy: How we stuffed it up
